quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Socks and Maid
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, birds, mail. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Joe had 29 pairs of socks. How many socks did he have?
One camera could take 350 pictures and Bob bought 3 cameras of the same type. How many pictures could he take?

In a house with a maid, a mail receiver, and a chef, the owner was murdered on a Sunday morning. The police questioned all the 3 people (the chef, the mail receiver, and the maid). The chef said; I was making her breakfast. The mail receiver said; I was getting the mail., and finally the maid said; I was cleaning her living room. The police arrested one of them right after the interview. Who got arrested?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The mail receiver

questions.question: If I had $654,987, how much change is that?
A woman once said about a man, I am not his wife but this mans mother is the mother-in-law of my mother. What were the man and the woman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A daughter and a father

questions.question: In a rectangular room there are 10 chairs. It is possible to arrange the chairs in such a way so that an equal number of chairs is set against each wall of the room.

A cowboy was looking after 100 animals (oxen, cows and calves). For his job he was paid $100 (for every ox he received $10, for every cow $5 and for every calf $0.5). How many were the oxen, the cows and the calves?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1 ox, 9 cows, 90 calves

questions.question: In an office building, there are 350 windows and half as many doors. How many doors are there in 3 office buildings?
One iPod can hold 950 songs and 3 movies. How many iPods of this model would one person have to buy to have 27 movies and 8550 songs?
If you have in your suitcase 6 white socks, 4 red socks, 8 green socks, and 2 brown socks, how many socks would you have to pull out (without looking at them) to be sure you have a matching pair?
A monster had double the amount of eyes he had ears, triple the amount of ears he had legs, and had six legs. How many eyes did he have?
A farmer had 20 sheep. All but 8 died. How many are still alive?
Five years ago the sum of the age of a sister and a brother was 8. What will be the same sum in 5 years?
There is a branch with 10 birds on it. I shot 2 of them and then 1 more. How many birds are left on the branch?
In a room, there can be two mothers and two daughters, three women in total.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Lamb and Farmer
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, hand, kismet. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Matt and Julie asked their son How was your day at school? and they always received the same BRUSQUE answer-fine. Brusque means habitual, constant, the same.
Marsha dug her FUNEREAL attire out of the closet. It consisted of a black dress and a black overcoat. What does funereal mean?

options.text: having to do with a funeral

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: having to do with a funeral

questions.question: A peasant buys a pregnant sheep, which gave birth to a lamb. At the age of 3, the lamb gives birth to another lamb. After that it starts bearing a lamb per year. How many sheep will the peasant have 9 years after the birth of the first lamb if all the lambs are female and none of them ever dies?
The newly blooming lavender was a HARBINGER of spring. It was beautiful and fragrant. What does harbinger mean?

options.text: a sign of things to come

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a sign of things to come

questions.question: A QUAGMIRE is a difficult or precarious situation.
After a long walk, two sons and two fathers find three apples. Each of them has an apple and they all go their way. How is that possible?

options.text: they were a boy, his father and his grandfather
one of them had a hidden apple

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: they were a boy, his father and his grandfather

questions.question: The fortune teller persuaded Anna that she needed a PHILTER to gain the attention of her beau. She only needed to apply the elixir and think of him. What does PHILTER mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: love potion

questions.question: A farmer had a yard, whose shape was a square, and in the four corners of this square there were apple trees. Some years later the farmer decided to make his yard twice as big and preserve the square shape. However, after the enlargement the four apple trees were still by the fence.
To ESCHEW something means to be attracted to it.

Her passion for art bordered on pathological MONOMANIA. Shes a sculptor, studies medieval art in night classes, frequents galleries and is often caught doodling in a notebook. What does monomania mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: excessive concentration one one subject

questions.question: It wasnt accidental it was pure KISMET that Joey fell in love with Laura. What does kismet mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: fate, destiny

questions.question: Jack grabbed Janets hand and they began to GAMBOL in the sunshine. They felt like children, not a care in the world. What does gambol mean?

options.text: to wager money on an outcome

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: to frolic and leap playfully

questions.question: A farmer had 9 cows. The first one produced 1 gallon of milk, the second one 2 gallons and so on. The ninth cow produced 9 gallons of milk. The farmer had three sons and he wanted to divide the cows in such a way that each of his sons received an equal number of cows and the cows of each produced an equal amount of milk. Is that possible?

In a lake there were lilies. The strange thing about them was that they doubled their number once per day. If on the 15th day half of the lake was covered with lilies, on which day will the whole lake be covered with them?

Because Ben travels to many countries for business, he has written a POLYGLOT lexicon for himself. It contains quick references on phrases he might need in any given situation. What does polyglot mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: containing many languages

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Tree and Fish
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, birds, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What number multiplied by 10 equals the square of the same number, times 5?
Complete the Latin term for an unacceptable person: persona non _____.

Two people get to a river and find a boat capable of accommodating only one person. Using this boat, both of them manage to cross the river. If they crossed without any of the them swiming the river which of the following is true?

options.text: The river was wider than longer.
They were on different banks of the river.
There was a bridge on the river.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They were on different banks of the river.

questions.question: There are three lemons. One of them is lighter than the other two, which have the same weight. Can we tell which of the lemons is the lighter one with just one measurement on the scales?
A tree is 20 meters tall. An ant is climbing it. Every day the ant climbs 5 meters, and each night it descends 4 meters. In how many days will the ant reach the top of the tree?

A bar of soap is placed on one of the sides of a pair of scales. On the other side there is 3/4 of a bar of the same soap and а 3/4 kg metal weight. The scales are in balance. How much does a bar of soap weigh?
There are three sorts of apples in a basket. How many apples have to be taken from the basket, without looking, to be sure that there are at least 2 apples of the same sort?
The name of what is coded in the following: 86,smopuim?

options.text: the name of a software product

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the name of a software product

questions.question: Five girls are sitting next to each other on a train.  Ann and Betty are as close to each other as Ann and Kate are.  Dana and Ann are sitting as close to each other as Dana and Kate are. Between which two of her friends is the fifth girl, Jane, sitting?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: between Ann and Betty

questions.question: A boy and a pig weigh as much as 5 crates. The pig weighs as much as 4 cats. 2 cats and the pig weigh as much as 3 crates. How many cats weigh as much as the boy?
Bob has a book of 100 pages and in 10 seconds he can count out 10 pages. What is the shortest time in which Bob can define where the 60th page is?

A man walked by an old fisherman and asked him how many fish he had caught. The fisherman replied: The half of the eight, the nine without its tail, and the six without its head. How many fish did the fisherman caught?
There are 15 birds sitting on the branches of a tree. A hunter goes by and shoots 3 of them. How many birds are left on the tree?
Which term refers to a king or prince in India?
A fish costs a dollar and half a fish. How much do 5 fish cost?

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Water and People
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, tawny, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What family of animals has species called Oryx, Duiker, Dik-dik and Impala?
This is a gun dog breed which is subdivided into Springer, Cocker, Cavalier King Charles, etc.
What is the only venomous snake native to the British Isles?
Is there a kind of coat that can only be put on wet?
What is the name of the characters that have appeared in Brian Herberts Legends of Dune universe, Disneys Aladdin and the video game System Shock 2?
Several rabbits and hens are placed together in a cage. How many rabbits and hens are there, if the total number of their heads is 35, and the combined number of their legs is 94?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 12 rabbits and 23 hens

questions.question: You are on a ship and over the side hangs a rope ladder with one foot rungs. The tide rises a one foot per hour. At the end of five hours, how much of the ladder will remain above the water assuming that 12 rungs were above the water when the tide began to rise?
This majestic bird can be golden, bald and tawny. One of the species is a symbol of the United States of America.
Can you take a picture of a person with a wooden leg?

This animal, also known as Suricate, is a member of the mongoose family. It has a long, thin tail which is used for balance when standing on hind legs. It lives underground in colonies of up to 30 individuals that operate an early warning system where sentries stand guard beside the burrow entrances and warn of approaching danger from predators.
A magician had a water glass filled to the top. Holding the glass above his head he let it drop to the floor without spilling a single drop of water. Is this possible?

10% of all the people living in a certain town in Georgia have unlisted phone numbers. If you selected 100 names at random from the towns phone book, on average, how many of these people would have unlisted phone numbers?
Is it  possible to name three consecutive days without using the words Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, or Sunday?
What is the name of the white crystalline sugar found in wood and straw?
A father has seven sons, and each son has one sister. How many children does the father have?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Day and Truth
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, people, mothers. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Were X-rays at one time proposed to be called Röntgen rays?
There are two kinds of people who live on a mysterious island. They are the so-called Honestants, who always speak the truth, and the others are the Swindlecants, who always lie.

options.text: visitor to the island went to a local pub and had a few drinks. When he was ready to leave he asked the bartender how much he owed. The bartender told him the total for his bill. It was quite expensive, so he asked the bartender if he spoke the truth. But the visitor did not hear the whispered answer so he asked a man sitting next to him about it. And the man said: The bartender said yes, but he is a big liar.

questions.question: Is xenophobia a fear of artificial lights?
When you add 55 and 45 the sum is 100. When you add 65 and 35 the sum is also 100. But which is greater: 55 multiplied by 45 or 65 multiplied by 35?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 55 multiplied by 45

questions.question: Two doctors and two mothers went to an ice cream shop. Each one of them ordered different flavors. The waiter then gave them one chocolate, one vanilla, and one strawberry and everybody on the table had an ice cream. Is this possible?

Three goddesses were sitting in an old Indian temple. Their names were Truth (who always tells the truth), Lie (who is always lying) and Wisdom (who sometimes lies). In order to figure out which goddess was which you posed the following questions to each:

options.text: king the left one: Who is sitting next to you?
king the middle one: Who are you?
d at last question for the right one: Who is your neighbor?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1. Wisdom 2. Lie 3. Truth

questions.question: What X-word means a colourless, flammable liquid ingredient used to make synthetic resins, dyes and insecticides?
You are on your way to visit your Grandma, who lives at the end of the valley. Its her birthday, and you want to give her the cakes youve made.

options.text: tween your house and her house, you have to cross 7 bridges, and as it goes in the land of make believe, there is a troll under every bridge! Each troll, quite rightly, insists that you pay a troll toll. Before you can cross their bridge, you have to give them half of the cakes you are carrying, but as they are kind trolls, they each give you back a single cake.

questions.question: We know very little about the life of the mathematician Diophantus (called the father of algebra) except that he lived around the year 250 B.C. Due to one admirer of his, who described his life by the means of an algebraic riddle, we can at least determine his age at death:

options.text: ophantuss youth lasted 1/6 of his life. He had his first beard in the next 1/12 of his life. At the end of the following 1/7 of his life Diophantus got married. Five years from then his son was born. His son lived exactly 1/2 of Diophantuss life. Diophantus died 4 years after the death of his son.

questions.question: A woman has 7 children, half of them are boys.

Two children were on their way to school, when they began to question what day of the week it was. They were so confused in their reckoning that one of them gave the following riddle to help sort the matter out: When the day after tomorrow is yesterday, then today will be as far from Sunday as that day was which was today when the day before yesterday was tomorrow!
My grandson is about as many days as my son is weeks, and my grandson is as many months as I am in years. My grandson, my son and I together are 120  years. Can you tell me my age in years?
Which word refers to a colourless, odourless gaseous element that occurs in trace amounts in air?
What plant tissue conducts water and mineral salts from its roots to other parts of the plant and also provides mechanical support?

It was Emilys first day at school. The teacher suggested that it would be a good idea for each child to meet every other child in the class. The teacher said, When you meet, please shake hands and introduce yourself by name. If there were 10 children in the class, how many were the total handshakes?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Wife and Ladder
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, globe, dessert. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: You meet two men who are playing a game. One of them tells only lies on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday, and during the rest of the week he speaks the truth. The other one lies only on Thursday Friday and Saturday and says the truth the rest of the time. Today they both say they were lying yesterday. Which day of the week is it?
What is the next letter in the sequence O, T, T, F, F, S, S, E,   ?

A firefighter stood on the middle rung of a ladder, spraying water on a burning house. He then climbed up 6 rungs before the heat of the flames caused him to come down 10 rungs. After some minutes he was able to climb 18 rungs to the very top of the ladder. How many rungs did the ladder have?
If there are three pineapples and you take two, how many will you have?
Cold is faster than hot.
Its quarter past three. Of how many degrees is the angle formed by the hands of the clock at this moment?
This dessert was created for and named after a famous ballet dancer in 1926.
Charlie asked Margaret how old she was and she answered him: In two years I will be twice as old as I was five years ago. How old is she?
This food is one of the most versatile and convenient. You can boil it, fry it, poach it, scramble it, use it in baking. What is it?
How long did the Hundred years war last?
A mother has 6 daughters and each of them has a brother. How many children are there?
The stubs obtained by burning ten candles will yield one extra candle if you melt them all together. If you burned 100 candles, how many extra candles could you make?

Paul designs food displays for the local Supermarket. For one of his displays, he wants to set up soup cans in the form of a square pyramid. Hes decided to use 10 cans for each side of the square base of the pyramid. If each carton holds 25 soup cans, how many cartons will Paul need to open to build the pyramid?
What food can be Chinese, Jerusalem and Globe?

A man burst into a police station soaking wet and started screaming My wife has been murdered, my wife has been murdered! A police officer asked what had happened and the man explained that when they were walking along the cliffs of the shore, he heard a big roll of thunder come out of nowhere. No further thunder washeard after the first one. He turned around startled to see what happened and then a huge bolt of lightning struck and he heard his wife scream. He turned around and saw his wife lying mangled on the sharp rocks at the bottom of the cliff, and he saw a man running away. Can the mans story be true?
